publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-8002 Cathy Peattie: Sign-VRS—That the Parliament welcomes the development by the social enterprise company, Sign-VRS, of a new video relay service that enables Deaf people to call anyone using the service’s BSL interpreters to translate the call; notes that Sign-VRS is the first dedicated video relay service in Scotland; further notes that Sign-VRS uses Sign-now.com technology, which is, uniquely in the United Kingdom, owned and managed by Deaf people, and, considers that the Scottish Government should support the wider use of this technology.

S3M-8002 Sign-VRS (lodged on 23 February 2011) Cathie Craigie*, Jackie Baillie*, Rhona Brankin*, Kenneth Gibson*, Hugh Henry*, John Wilson*, Jamie Hepburn*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Robin Harper*, Marlyn Glen*, Mary Mulligan*, Elaine Murray*, Elaine Smith*, Karen Whitefield*, Patricia Ferguson*, Hugh O’Donnell*

S3M-8002 Cathy Peattie: Sign-VRS—That the Parliament welcomes the development by the social enterprise company, Sign-VRS, of a new video relay service that enables Deaf people to call anyone using the service’s BSL interpreters to translate the call; notes that Sign-VRS is the first dedicated video relay service in Scotland; further notes that Sign-VRS uses Sign-now.com technology, which is, uniquely in the United Kingdom, owned and managed by Deaf people, and, considers that the Scottish Government should support the wider use of this technology. Supported by: Cathie Craigie, Jackie Baillie, Rhona Brankin, Kenneth Gibson, Hugh Henry, John Wilson, Jamie Hepburn, Dr Richard Simpson, Robin Harper, Marlyn Glen, Mary Mulligan, Elaine Murray, Elaine Smith, Karen Whitefield, Patricia Ferguson, Hugh O’Donnell, Jack McConnell*, Trish Godman*
S3M-8002 Sign-VRS (lodged on 23 February 2011) Dave Thompson*

S3M-8002 Cathy Peattie: Sign-VRS—That the Parliament welcomes the development by the social enterprise company, Sign-VRS, of a new video relay service that enables Deaf people to call anyone using the service’s BSL interpreters to translate the call; notes that Sign-VRS is the first dedicated video relay service in Scotland; further notes that Sign-VRS uses Sign-now.com technology, which is, uniquely in the United Kingdom, owned and managed by Deaf people, and, considers that the Scottish Government should support the wider use of this technology. Supported by: Cathie Craigie, Jackie Baillie, Rhona Brankin, Kenneth Gibson, Hugh Henry, John Wilson, Jamie Hepburn, Dr Richard Simpson, Robin Harper, Marlyn Glen, Mary Mulligan, Elaine Murray, Elaine Smith, Karen Whitefield, Patricia Ferguson, Hugh O’Donnell, Jack McConnell, Trish Godman, Dave Thompson
